column4: OK I have to ask again, If windows is on /dev/hda5 then I should point grub to (hd2,4) correct?
you are sure it's not 0,4 ?
how would I tell?
woulnd't 2.4 mean the fith partition on the third physical drive?  that wouldn't be hda, that would be hdc
I made a mistake, I meant hdc5
It's a laptop, the HD is recognized as hdc for some reason
hdc5 would be 2,4, yes
crap, well then something else is broke
i seem to think i'm connected to the internet here
can you ping by ip number?
I sure can, I've pinged my router
dhcp involved?
correct
system > administration > networking
look under dns
then try pinging each server there by ip address
the only IP there is the router IP
okay, there's the problem, the router is not telling you your isp's dns servers
well tats not good at all, how do I fix this
first off, i'd check into what is wrong with the router, but may i /msg you?
yep /msg away
